body_html:
@Maratyszcza I think this is a legit error. The user is building C2 on Jetson pack with TX2, which means it has CUDA as well as NEON. Hence the ifndef will route the code to caff2::math::BiasCHW<CUDAContext> which is not defined:

pytorch/caffe2/operators/conv_transpose_op_impl.h

Line 120 in 921dece

math::BiasCHW<T, Context>(
.

We should really use GEMM here. The straightforward solution is to split the code for ConvTranspose but it will result in quite a a bit duplicated code. Any magic macro that we can use? :)

body:
@Maratyszcza I think this is a legit error. The user is building C2 on Jetson pack with TX2, which means it has CUDA as well as NEON. Hence the `ifndef` will route the code to `caff2::math::BiasCHW<CUDAContext>` which is not defined: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/921dece2d7de7ab25f87a295c4589f5600778155/caffe2/operators/conv_transpose_op_impl.h#L120. 

We should really use GEMM here. The straightforward solution is to split the code for `ConvTranspose` but it will result in quite a a bit duplicated code. Any magic macro that we can use? :)
